txt.en:
'Is this... it? This is the fabled Marâkh, Mother of Tempests?

'It is quite exquisite. Clearly crafted by a talented smith, but I feel nothing from it. If this thing once wielded the power to control the storms of the seas, it does not seem to possess it now.

'Alas, it is just a novel trinket, but we will display it nonetheless! It is a part of the history of the isles. Perhaps one day, it shall grace us with its power, and we shall make safe the isles from its burden of being a graveyard of ships.

'You have my eternal gratitude.'
Hûrlub has given you the tempest hammer and explains that he must rest now.
Hûrlub the Bellower was grateful for your help with the spiders and has given you Marâkh, Mother of Tempests.

'You take old toy. Hûrlub no need anymore.

'Hûrlub just want sleep. Hûrlub and you are friend now.

'See you.'
